results.title: Ski tips
results.description: Skiing families desperate for a last-minute getaway at half-term could try Leisure Direction Ski (020-824 3030), which has space left in France's highest resort, Val Thorens. The firm is offering a week's self catering in apartments sleeping up to five people, for a total of £841. Customers have to drive the Alps, but the price covers car-ferry crossings. Val Thorens is part of the enormous Trois Vallées ski network which also includes Méribel and Courchevel. Snowcoach (01727 866177) has full-board, one-week holidays in Austria's Mayrhofen costing £399 for adult and £339 for children. The price includes coach travel from London Victoria, Watford, Bexley or Dover or, for a supplement, from 30 other pick-up points. Departure is on February 16.

results.title: Travelogue
results.description:
Cottage industry
What do a group of cottages in a hamlet near Manchester have in common with Turtle Island in Fiji and the Victoria Falls Safari Lodge in Zimbabwe? They have all been recognised for outstanding environmental performance in the Green Globe awards, which were established in 1994 after the Rio Earth Summit to promote sustainable tourism that works with communities, companies and consumers. Boardmans, near Bury, is a group of 17th-century cottages and apartments in the foothills of the Pennines. The cottages range from £45 a night for two people and the apartments from £35 a night. For details, call 01204 882844 or visit www.good.co.uk

results.title: Dame Shirley of Tel Aviv
results.description: Dame Shirley Porter would not agree to talk in her flat in Israel, overlooking the sea. 'People write about gold taps and that sort of thing,' she said, accurately. Instead we would take a trip by boat down the Yarkon River which flows through Tel Aviv on its way from the hills of the West Bank to the Mediterranean and which is indisputably filthy. In 1997 three athletes at the Maccabi Games the Jewish Olympics fell into the water when a bridge they were crossing collapsed. They later died, not from injuries incurred when the structure gave way, but from poisoning.

results.title: Two nations linked by blood, sweat and toil
results.description: More than 2,000 invited guests and representatives of the world's media will swoop on Folkestone and Calais to watch the heads of state try out the tunnel. Yet the elaborate celebrations have a hollow ring: lengthy testing of trains has meant the tunnel is still not open for business. A limited inter-capital Eurostar foot passenger service will start in July the first Le Shuttle car services are due to start in October.
